fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025e3.equipments.heater

Class HeaterController

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
      • fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025e3.equipments.heater.HeaterController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI, HeaterPushImplementationI

    public class HeaterController
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
implements HeaterPushImplementationI
    The class ThermostatedHeaterController implements a controller component for the thermostated heater.

    Description

    The controller is a simple fixed period threshold-based controller with hysteresis. It has two control modes. In a pull mode, it calls the pull sensors of the heater to get the target and current temperatures. In the push mode, it sets the period for the heater to push the temperatures data towards it and perform once its control decision upon each reception. It also uses a push pattern to receive changes in the state of the heater. For example, when the heater is switched on, it sends a state data telling the controller that it is now on so that the controller can begins its control until the heater is switched off.

    Glass-box Invariants

     invariant       hysteresis > 0.0
 invariant       controlPeriod > 0
 invariant       executionMode.isStandard() || clockURI != null && !clockURI.isEmpty()
 invariant       sensorIBP_URI != null && !sensorIBP_URI.isEmpty()
 invariant       actuatorIBPURI != null && !actuatorIBPURI.isEmpty()

    Black-box Invariants

     invariant       STANDARD_HYSTERESIS > 0.0
 invariant       STANDARD_CONTROL_PERIOD > 0

    Created on : 2022-10-27

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
